entries.meaning: The act by which something is dereferenced.
examples: Either each dereference must use a complicated DCAS protocol, or each pointer must include a version number that is managed on each modification and checked on each dereference, or storage management must be tightly coupled  […]

verbs.description: dereference (third-person singular simple present dereferences, present participle dereferencing, simple past and past participle dereferenced)

entries.meaning: (programming) To access the value or object located in a memory location stored in a pointer or another value interpreted as such; to access a value being referenced by something else.
examples: Attempting to dereference a null pointer often results in a crash.

entries.meaning: (computing, in operating systems derived from Unix) To operate on the file or directory pointed to by a symbolic link, rather than on the link itself.
examples: With the find command, any symbolic links appearing after -follow will be dereferenced.
